accessibility.question: What is web accessibility?
options: Making websites as complex as possible
Ensuring websites are usable only on mobile devices
Ensuring websites are usable by everyone, regardless of disability
Designing websites for a specific group of people
accessibility.answer: Ensuring websites are usable by everyone, regardless of disability

accessibility.question: Name two benefits of having an accessible website.
options: Faster loading times and more ads
Increased user engagement and legal compliance
accessibility.answer: Increased user engagement and legal compliance

accessibility.question: What does the acronym WCAG stand for?
accessibility.answer: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines

accessibility.question: What is the purpose of alternative texts in images?
options: To make the website look better
To provide a textual alternative of the image for screen reader users
accessibility.answer: To provide a textual alternative of the image for screen reader users

accessibility.question: Give an example of how a website can be more accessible for people with visual impairments.
accessibility.answer: Having text-to-speech functionality

accessibility.question: What is a screen reader, and what is it used for?
options: A tool for reading text aloud from a computer screen, used primarily by people with visual impairments
A device that protects computer screens
A program that reads only the headlines of articles
accessibility.answer: A tool for reading text aloud from a computer screen, used primarily by people with visual impairments

accessibility.question: Name a basic tool to check a website's accessibility.
accessibility.answer: A web accessibility evaluation tool

accessibility.question: Why is color contrast important in web accessibility?
options: It makes the website more visually appealing
It is not important for accessibility
It helps users with color vision deficiencies and low vision to read and perceive content
accessibility.answer: It helps users with color vision deficiencies and low vision to read and perceive content

accessibility.question: What type of disability benefits from the use of subtitles in videos?
accessibility.answer: Hearing impairments

accessibility.question: Give an example of how a website can be accessible to users with motor disabilities.
options: By requiring the use of a mouse only
Limiting the use of interactive elements
accessibility.answer: Ensuring keyboard navigation is possible

accessibility.question: How does text size and spacing affect web accessibility?
options: It does not have a significant impact
Larger text and adequate spacing can improve readability for users with visual impairments
Smaller text is generally more accessible
Text size and spacing should only be considered for mobile devices
accessibility.answer: Larger text and adequate spacing can improve readability for users with visual impairments

accessibility.question: Explain what ARIA is in the context of web accessibility.
options: A programming language for web development
Accessible Rich Internet Applications, a set of attributes to make web content more accessible
A tool for automated web testing
accessibility.answer: Accessible Rich Internet Applications, a set of attributes to make web content more accessible

accessibility.question: What are the three WCAG compliance levels, and what do they mean?
options: A, AA, AAA - Accessible, More Accessible, Most Accessible
A, B, C - Basic, Better, Complete
Basic, Intermediate, Advanced - Levels of difficulty
accessibility.answer: A, AA, AAA - Accessible, More Accessible, Most Accessible

accessibility.question: How can a web form be made more accessible?
options: By using complex layouts and scripting
Providing clear labels, instructions, and easy navigation
Making it visually attractive with advanced graphics
Forms should not be used to ensure accessibility
accessibility.answer: Providing clear labels, instructions, and easy navigation

accessibility.question: Mention a technique to make tables accessible.
options: Providing proper header tags and descriptions
accessibility.answer: Providing proper header tags and descriptions

accessibility.question: What is keyboard navigation, and why is it important?
options: It is the ability to navigate a website using the mouse only
The ability to navigate a website using keyboard shortcuts, important for users with motor impairments
A feature only needed for gaming websites
Keyboard navigation is not important for accessibility
accessibility.answer: The ability to navigate a website using keyboard shortcuts, important for users with motor impairments

accessibility.question: Explain how responsive design contributes to accessibility.
options: Responsive design is only about visual appeal
It ensures websites are accessible only on mobile devices
It makes websites accessible and usable across a variety of devices and screen sizes
Responsive design makes websites slower and less accessible
accessibility.answer: It makes websites accessible and usable across a variety of devices and screen sizes

accessibility.question: What are some common mistakes that affect web accessibility?
options: Lack of alternative text for images, poor color contrast, missing form labels
accessibility.answer: Lack of alternative text for images, poor color contrast, missing form labels

accessibility.question: Describe how the use of color alone can be an accessibility issue.
options: It makes the website more attractive and accessible
Using color alone as an indicator can be problematic for color-blind users
All users perceive colors in the same way
Color is not relevant to accessibility
accessibility.answer: Using color alone as an indicator can be problematic for color-blind users

accessibility.question: What is the 'mobile-first' approach, and how does it impact accessibility?
options: Focusing on desktop design before mobile
Ignoring mobile devices in web design
Designing for mobile devices first, which can improve accessibility due to the need for simpler, more flexible layouts
Mobile-first approach is not related to accessibility
accessibility.answer: Designing for mobile devices first, which can improve accessibility due to the need for simpler, more flexible layouts

accessibility.question: Explain the difference between accessibility and usability.
options: Accessibility is about legal requirements, usability is not
Accessibility focuses on people with disabilities, usability is broader
Usability is a part of accessibility
accessibility.answer: Accessibility focuses on people with disabilities, usability is broader

accessibility.question: Describe how to implement accessible navigation control with ARIA.
options: Using ARIA roles and properties indiscriminately
Adding ARIA labels to all elements
Using ARIA landmarks and roles to define navigation areas
ARIA is not used for navigation control
accessibility.answer: Using ARIA landmarks and roles to define navigation areas

accessibility.question: Discuss the implications of the Communications and Video Accessibility Act (CVAA) for websites.
options: It mandates accessibility for all offline communications
It applies only to government websites
It requires accessible communication methods on websites
It has no implications for websites
accessibility.answer: It requires accessible communication methods on websites

accessibility.question: Discuss accessibility considerations for complex interactive components.
options: Complex components cannot be made accessible
Accessibility is not necessary for interactive components
Focus on keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility
accessibility.answer: Focus on keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility

accessibility.question: Explain the concept of 'inclusive accessibility' in web design.
options: Designing websites for a specific group of disabilities
Making websites accessible only to a certain region
Designing for all users, considering a wide range of abilities and disabilities
accessibility.answer: Designing for all users, considering a wide range of abilities and disabilities

accessibility.question: How is an accessibility audit conducted, and what tools are used?
options: Auditing only the homepage with basic tools
Using automated tools only to evaluate the entire website
Combining automated testing with manual evaluation and user testing
accessibility.answer: Combining automated testing with manual evaluation and user testing

accessibility.question: Describe best practices for accessibility in single-page web applications (SPA).
options: Using dynamic content without ARIA roles
Ensuring dynamic content updates are announced by screen readers
Single-page applications can't be made accessible
accessibility.answer: Ensuring dynamic content updates are announced by screen readers

accessibility.question: Explain the challenges of accessibility in user-generated content.
options: User-generated content does not need to be accessible
Only professional content needs to be accessible
Moderating for accessibility and providing guidelines for users
accessibility.answer: Moderating for accessibility and providing guidelines for users

accessibility.question: What are the legal implications of not complying with web accessibility regulations?
options: No implications, as regulations are voluntary
Potential legal action and fines for non-compliance
Only a warning is given for non-compliance
Regulations apply only outside the US
accessibility.answer: Potential legal action and fines for non-compliance

accessibility.question: Analyze the impact of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence, on web accessibility.
options: They have no impact on accessibility
They can enhance accessibility features and personalization
Emerging technologies are only for advanced users
accessibility.answer: They can enhance accessibility features and personalization
